title: Introduction to Apache Cassandra‚Ñ¢ Workshop!
description:
üö® Register for DataStax AstraDB: http://dtsx.io/2OQ0hJp - No credit card required, $25.00 USD credit every month, roughly 30M reads, 5M writes, 40GB storage monthly - sufficient to run small production workloads.

Welcome to the 'Intro to Cassandra for Developers' workshop! In this two-hour workshop, the Developer Advocate team of DataStax shows the most important fundamentals and basics of the powerful distributed NoSQL database Apache Cassandra. Using Astra, the cloud based Cassandra-as-a-Service platform delivered by DataStax, we will cover the very first steps for every developer who wants to try to learn a new database: creating tables and CRUD operations.

üì• All Workshop resources 
https://github.com/DataStax-Academy/Intro-to-Cassandra-for-Developers

Learn more about Cassandra at Apache (https://cassandra.apache.org/doc/latest/)  and DataStax (https://docs.datastax.com/en/landing_page/doc/landing_page/cassandra.html) documentation websites.

About DataStax: DataStax is the company behind the massively scalable, highly available, cloud-native NoSQL data platform built on Apache Cassandra‚Ñ¢. DataStax gives developers and enterprises the freedom to run data in any cloud, Kubernetes, hybrid or bare metal at global scale with zero downtime and zero lock-in. More than 450 of the world‚Äôs leading enterprises including Capital One, Cisco, Comcast, Delta Airlines, Macy‚Äôs, McDonald‚Äôs, Safeway, Sony, and Walmart use DataStax to build transformational data architectures for real-world outcomes. For more, visit DataStax.com and @DataStax.
